messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Sick
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 4/27/01 5:28:39 AM Pacific Daylight Time, aisliin@yahoo.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 4/27/01 5:28:39 AM Pacific Daylight Time,
aisliin@... writes:

<< I am taking colloidal Silver,
the rememdy I mentioned yesterday, for this throat
infection. I began taking it late yesterday morning,
and I am feeling worlds better. >>

I have had great experiences with colloidal silver, including getting
rid of a urinary tract infection...used this and cranberry extract plus drank
pure cranberry juice diluted with just water.
I've also warded off flus that everyone else was getting by starting on
the colloidal silver right away before getting sick. It's good for fighting
bacteria, viruses, and fungal infections.

Lucy

messages.subject: [Unschooling-dotcom] Sick
messages.msgSnippet: ... It s a natural antibiotic. Vic
messages.messageBody:
>Take lots of vitamin C and Echinacea...drink lots of
>water and orange juice, and sleep, sleep, sleep!! >>

>You might want to try some colloidal silver, as well.
It's a natural antibiotic.
Vic

<<sounds like mumps or tonsilitis. Could be trep...its
>been going around real good right now. You'd better
>go in anyway whether you want to or not..no herbal
>remedy will work against any of the above.

>I disagree. The right natural remedies are out there
>for basically everything.
>Vic

Forgive me for lumping these together, but I am on
digest now and this is the most expedient way to
address all of these at once. I'm with you Vic, there
is an herbal remedy for just about everything, but in
our chemically driven society it is sometimes hard to
find the right ones. I am taking colloidal Silver,
the rememdy I mentioned yesterday, for this throat
infection. I began taking it late yesterday morning,
and I am feeling worlds better. Not feverish and
achey anymore, and the swelling in my throat has gone
way down, as has the pain. My throat still hurts
some, but it is more tollerable now, like a bad sore
throat, and I am able to control it with extra
strength tylenol.

I had to get up this morning at 3:30, after having
slept a good portion of yesterday and all night last
night I was all slept out! After bothering my hubby
for as long as I felt I resonably could (grin), I got
up and started some homemade soup in the crock pot.
Plenty of onions and whole garlic cloves. That should
fix me up!

Thank you to everyone for your good wishes. I am sure
they played a part too!

Nanci K.

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Sick
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 4/26/1 4:01:41 AM, Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 4/26/1 4:01:41 AM, Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
writes:

<<I did mean it for Nancy...
Take lots of vitamin C and Echinacea...drink lots of water and orange juice,
and sleep, sleep, sleep!! >>

Nancy,

You might want to try some colloidal silver, as well. It's a natural
antibiotic. You should be able to find it at your local health food store
and they should be able to tell you how to use it, etc. Hope that helps too.

Vic
